intro: Stenogyne acuta, commonly known as the acute stenogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
